topics.body:
I still remember my time in high school where during a test, most people would cheat their papers by discussing, carrying notes or share test papers.

*I DESPISE CHEATING.* It unfair to those who deserve success when the cheaters get to receive the praise while you suck at the back for being honest.
When people cheated in tests at high school. I would give them a glare that says "You are not my friend." and decline them of any answers. I would be strict to them by avoiding and ignoring them when they do work. I would say cheating is bad and you should feel bad. They would literally become my enemies but that's OK.

_+Because I rule them.+_

Despite my none-cheating lifestyle, I got the best grades in school by a mile, easily beating all the cheaters and liars. I got so good that people started to stop cheating and study honestly. Even though they had bad grades at first, I helped them and ignored any cheaters. They became better and got average grades which is good enough for them to succeed. I felt happy and proud for them.

Though, I guess I should also thank the cheaters despite me hating them. If it weren't for them, I wouldn't have been so motivated, got awesome grades and _crush them like the cheaters they are._

[spoiler]This is just me missing high school. :D[/spoiler]
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976
